channel.title: Elasticse on Rimon's Weblog
channel.description: Recent content in Elasticse on Rimon's Weblog

item.title: Installing and Running Kibana
item.description: Installing Kibana and Console _This article is part of a series. Check out the full series [icon name=“external-link” class=“” unprefixedclass=“”] Kibana is an open source analytics and visualization platform designed to work with Elasticsearch and Console (Previously its name was Sence, Sence was renamed to Console and it is available on Kibana 5.*) is a Kibana plugin [](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/guide/2.x/running-elasticsearch.html#id-1.4.3.13.19.2.2)[](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/guide/2.x/running-elasticsearch.html#id-1.4.3.13.19.2.3)that provides an interactive console for submitting requests to Elasticsearch directly from your browser.
